description: From a dialectal variant of nither, nether.

verbs.description: nidder (third-person singular simple present nidders, present participle niddering, simple past and past participle niddered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, Scotland) To keep down or under.
(transitive, Scotland) To press hard upon; straiten (applied to bounds).
(transitive, Scotland) To pinch or starve with cold or hunger; stunt in growth.
(transitive, Scotland) To harass; grill; plague; annoy.
